name: 賴冠廷
objective:
The goal of this course is to give students a broad overview of state-of-the-art deep learning algorithms, and teach students how to develop deep learning applications by hands-on coding examples. Most examples taught in this class are based on the TensorFlow framework. We will cover many different fields including image classification, object detection, natural language processing, reinforcement learning and generative adversarial networks. The syllabus is listed as follows:
•　　Number and Character recognition
•　　Image Classification for 1000 categories
•　　Object Detection for 9000 objects
•　　Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)
•　　Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN)
•　　Long-Short Term Memory (LSTM)
•　　Transformer, BERT, and GPT-3
•　　Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)
•　　Deep Reinforcement Learning
schedule:
1.   Intro to Deep Learning
2.   Applied Math (Linear Algebra, Probability, Calculus)
3.   Machine Learning Basics
4.   TensorFlow & Keras        
5.   Convolutional Neural Networks        
6.   Advanced Keras API
7.   NLP & Word Embedding
8.   RNN/LSTM and Stock Price Prediction
9.   Attention & Transformer, BERT, GPT-3      
10. Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)
11. Object Detection and Segmentation
12. Deep Reinforcement Learning
scorePolicy: Homework (40%), Midterm and Final Exam (30%) Final Project (30%)
materials:
1. Francois Chollet, “Deep Learning with Python, ” Manning, 2017
2. Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, and Aaron Courville, “Deep Learning,” MIT Press, 2017
3. Latest publications on CVPR, NIPS, ICML, AAAI, ICLR

Website: http://www.aiotlab.org/teaching/dl_app.html
